results.title: Po river valley (Italy)
results.creator_credit: Louis de Rochemont Associates and John Ferno
results.brief_description: The Po River Valley contains half the population of Italy and is the centre of the textiles industries and steel mills. The rivers furnish electricity. Milan is the chief city, and industrial and finance centre, and we are shown a number of street scenes. Then we move into a typical farming community, the centre of which is a church over a thousand years old. The bells of this church summon the people to work in the morning, toll the lunch hour at noon and indicate the end of the workday in the late afternoon. This film shows glimpses of the community and the many shops that cater for the needs of the inhabitants and the trades that are handed down from father to son for generations, the women washing clothes on the riverbanks, and the men sitting over their coffee in the cafe. The church bell tolls for the last time during the day at sunset when the streets are gradually deserted.

results.title: Pneumonia
results.brief_description: A study of the dangers of neglecting pneumonic infection, how pneumonia is treated today and the effectiveness of newsy discovered drugs in reducing the death-rate due to pneumonia.

results.title: Pluto's Christmas tree (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Jack Hannah
results.brief_description: The second last entry in the theatrical Mickey Mouse series which officially began in 1928. As in many of his latter cartoons, Mickey is largely a background foil of others, in this case Pluto and Chip ‘n’ Dale. Animated by George Kreisl, Fred Moore, Bill Justice, Volus Jones. Music by Joseph S. Dubin.

results.title: Pluto
results.brief_description: This compilation of classic Disney cartoons begins with a brief introductory history of Walt Disney’s famous original creation, Mickey Mouse, along with several early b&w cartoon excerpts. Then enjoy seven heart-warming adventures with everybody’s favourite cartoon dog, Pluto.
